website_summaries.verdict: While this cast iron oil is long-lasting and offers a nice scent and texture, the low smoke point can be problematic, especially when preparing dishes that require high cook temperatures.
pros: Made of refined coconut oil, which doesn't tend to get sticky and has a light, pleasant scent
Stays fresh with no refrigeration required
cons: Has a low smoke point, which  will result in a smoked-filled kitchen if you aren't careful

customer_reviews.title: I tried this on my Griswold pan after running out ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried this on my Griswold pan after running out of the Camp Chef conditioner. After putting a very thin layer of this oil on the pan, I noticed a lot more smoke/burn of the oil at a lower heat. The Camp Chef conditioner could take a lot more heat and this oil burned at a lower temperature. I.e. I couldn't pre heat the pan without getting a lot of smoke. I'll give it a few more tries and really make sure I'm not putting a lot of oil on the pan (thought I did that already).
customer_reviews.author: K. Keith

customer_reviews.title: Good product with a few issues
customer_reviews.text: I like this product and the fact that it is made from all plant-based ingredients. There are a few issues that made me give it a four-star rating. 1. The flip-top lid leaks (in fact it was leaking in the Amazon box when I got it), and when you squirt the oil into the pan, it always drips down the side of the bottle no matter what you do. 2. It's not as emollient as other cast-iron pan conditioners I have used. It feels like you need to use more than you should. 3. I'm not sure how I feel about it having a scent. It's pretty subtle, but it doesn't seem necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Jen S.

customer_reviews.title: Love cast iron now because of this oil.
customer_reviews.text: I love this oil. I almost gave up on cast iron but tried this oil and every thing turned around when I found Caron oil. It's wonderful! From the first time I used it,. I fell in love with my cast iron. It was immediately effective. The first time I used my brand new Lodge pan, I was able to fry eggs in a totally nonstick pan! It smells great, but does not leave that smell on the food. It does have a low smoke point but food still does not stick and cooks well. It doesn't get sticky or build up. It makes me love cast iron again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L.

customer_reviews.title: This product does make a difference on my cast iron and carbon steel
customer_reviews.text: I am a longtime cast iron user and more recently carbon steel frying pans and have always used vegetable oil to clean and before putting away and that has worked well. I started reading more about flax seed oil and was intrigued because some of our cast iron is at the cabin and we can go a while between visits and the flax seed oil doesn't go rancid. Happy to report that seems to be the case - a better, less sticky, less heavy coating on the pans. Pleasant smell and lighter oil make it easy to use and it seems to adhere really well. Glad I ran across this - bottles at home and the cabin now.
customer_reviews.author: JTR WA

customer_reviews.title: Good quality oil that has helped maintain the seasoning on my cast iron and carbon steel pans.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. The smell is very citrus-y and my family likes it. It has a very thin consistency which is nice. It does not take a lot to coat a pan. Very happy with the product. My only gripe is of the bottle. No matter what you do, it will drip when you pour it out, getting the bottle oily I, like others, have transferred it into another bottle to prevent the spilling.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food from sticking
customer_reviews.text: The first bottle I received had been crushed and was leaking inside the bubble envelope. I contacted the seller, who immediately shipped another bottle. The second one arrived in undamaged condition. Amazon needs to ship these in a small box instead of a bubble envelope, which isn't protective enough. The oil itself works very well to season my cast iron pans. After cleaning, I heat the pan on the stove and let it cool, then wipe on a little oil with a paper towel. The next time I use it, the food doesn't stick to the pan. I like this better than the flaxseed oil I had been using, and will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernbelleV

customer_reviews.title: Use sparingly immediately after cleaning, in warm pan
customer_reviews.text: I use this right after cleaning. It doesn’t take much, but make sure pan is warm (I use hot water to clean with my chainmail scrubber, it’s usually hot enough so I don’t have to turn burner on.) I also like that it doesn’t add any flavor to whatever you cook after. Keeping cast iron non-stick is so important and this does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: 20 Acres and a Mule

customer_reviews.title: Smells like cheap candle smoke
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be suntan lotion with strong perfume and when you season your house will smell like cheap candle smoke like petroleum even though the bottle says it does not contain petroleum it smells like it does when seasoning. I am returning my cast iron pan for a new one and I will season it with plain oil. I do not want my kitchen to smell like this when i cook.
customer_reviews.author: Ripper

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The magic stuff is expensive, but leaves my cast iron wonderfully clean and conditioned. Even if I don't use my pan for several weeks, when I remove it from the cupboard, the pan is in ready to go condition. No gloopy mess like using veg oil use to leave. I just place the cast iron oil in a very small glass spray bottle, and use it sparingly on the pans after wiping out with paper towels, or scrubbing with SS chain-link scrubber. No soap ever touch's my cast iron or carbon steel pans.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my seasoned surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on both my cast iron and carbon steel pans, only one each thank God! Both the seasoned surfaces were ruined! It’s taken days and concerted effort to recover the seasoned surfaces that I had prior to the application of this product. I only used a drop or two on each of the two pans and immediately put the entire bottle in the trash. I will never use this product and could never recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Charles N. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Safe, effective cast iron seasoning
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased as a gift for a relative who has a superb collection of cast iron cookware. I decided to see how it works on a couple pieces I own, and it does a wow-gee-whiz job! I suspected I should have purchased two bottles to begin with, and my trial use confirmed that thought. It also worked beautifully of a wok with a couple decades worth of seasoning. Next I have a cast iron pair of Foo Dogs that are in need of some restoration, and suspect that this will preserve them once I remove the corrosion inside.
customer_reviews.author: WendyB

customer_reviews.title: Great seasoning oil, a little goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: I have been using canola oil on my cast iron cookware, of which I have a fair amount. This seasoning oil is rather more expensive, but works much better and only takes a little to do the job once you've started with it, so it winds up being pretty cost-effective.
customer_reviews.author: readerTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: quite satisfied with the result
customer_reviews.text: It coats the dull dry looks of the gas stove top iron grates after a cleaning process removes the shiny sheen giving decent shine. The product leaves a faint pleasant smell. The label on the bottle reads "for the restoration of non-stick pans"; but I use it for my gas stove top grates. I am quite satisfied with the result. It doesn't clean baked on old stains on the iron grates thus 4 stars are given. But that may be too much to expect.
customer_reviews.author: A hiker

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: This stuff made my food taste really weird and it was extremely smokey. Just stick with canola/vegetable oil.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Smells like lemongrass
customer_reviews.text: This product smells like lemongrass but it's supposed to be coconut oil. The lemon flavor did transfer to my food. It doesn't create a hard surface like Crisco or flax seed oil does.
customer_reviews.author: Jennette

customer_reviews.title: I'm a fan
customer_reviews.text: This is my first purchase of a cast iron seasoning oil. I've used coconut oil on my cast iron in the past, but it didn't coat or protect the pans like this oil. I've only used it for 2 weeks now, which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. I'll need more time to give a more accurate rating. So far, I'm a fan!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanna

customer_reviews.title: Seal was broken
customer_reviews.text: The seal was broken when I got it. Also the label was beat up and faded - this clearly was really old and improperly handled. No way it's touching my food. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: I like using this oil for my cast iron pans much better than regular cooking oil. After you wipe it on, you can wipe off excess and it doesn't leave as much oily feeling in my pan. Eliminates rusting. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Works good, second bottle.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second bottle, and this works really well. I had bought a smaller bottle originally as I didn't know if it worked or not. At first, I tended to use too much but have found just a couple of drops after cleaning is more than adequate. It helps build up a nice patina, does not get rancid, and I will continue using this as long as the vendor offers it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Carmack

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for cast iron seasoning
customer_reviews.text: Have a newer pre-seasoned cast iron skillet. So far, this has worked the best. Still not “non-stick”, but not sure if there is anything better. I like it and will buy it again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Shane S. Henry

customer_reviews.title: I love how well this oil conditions my new cast iron ...
customer_reviews.text: I love how well this oil conditions my new cast iron skillet. I purchased my skillet a couple of weeks ago and followed all the initial instructions. Now, after each cleaning, I heat my skillet and spread a thin coat of Cast Iron Oil. For cooking, I use a HIGH HEAT OIL. After cooking, I COOL my skillet, wipe thoroughly with a lint free cloth, heat and condition with Caron & Doucet cast iron oil. I cook EVERY FOOD category, 3 times a day, in this skillet. It appears that their non-stick feature is building because my husband thinks I've learned to cook perfect eggs-over-easy. Thanks Caron & Doucet for keeping my secret.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It WORKS.  A great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS PRODUCT. Unfortunately, someone in my building must love it too because my package was stolen! I will have to order again. It's a FANTASTIC product for all your cast iron!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L. Loving

customer_reviews.title: smokes upon next use
customer_reviews.text: smells nice and has a nice texture but what i really dont like is it has a really low smoke point so whenever i have used this and then go to preheat my skillet next use - the skillet starts to smoke quick which is annoyibg and also very unhealthy to have the carcinogens in the smoke go into the food im cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Loved this oil
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It seasoned my cast iron skillet very well: not sticky at all. You also use it to re-oil your pan after cooking with it. I will definitely keep this oil in my cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it's a pretty good while before I cook in my black iron pot. This oil is perfect as it doesn't go rancid. I'll keep using this oil for sure.
customer_reviews.author: bobbyd

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product, especially since it stays smooth and does not go goopy and rancid like lard and crisco which my mom and aunts used, not to mention the smell. It turned me off cast iron as I went to teflon, horrible mistake. I gave up cooking for five years when I had to have hospitalizations. I saw an add for a beautiful set of cast iron, ditched the old cookware and am very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen C. Weidner, customer of Kiss

customer_reviews.title: I ALSO use this on my BUTCHER BLOCK! Fantastic stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I ALSO use this on my BUTCHER BLOCK! Fantastic stuff! Just a proven suggestion for butcher blocks and wooden cutting boards. I use this on my cast iron but it has done a beautiful job of maintaining other organic or porous items around my kitchen. It's 100% ORGANIC & smells great too. It's also not harsh on bare hands.
customer_reviews.author: ZZZ Accounting Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant Product to Use
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Love the fragrance and the ease of use. I used it to re-season my Emeril LaGasse 10" fry pan that had a small amount of rust on it. I put it in the outside grill to prevent smoking up the house.. It came out great after I gently used plain steel wool prior to oiling it. Very pleasant and easy to use. Just branched out and got a 12" fry pan from Aldi's for $9.99. Will use your oil to season it before using it. Thank you for such a pleasant product that is so easy to apply. Would recommend it to anyone looking for an alternative to Crisco.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than oil that turns, and scary things that grow in lard.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Allison

customer_reviews.title: Smells clean and cooked in
customer_reviews.text: It works well when you've done most of the scrubbing. If your pans are really bad it takes lots of elbow grease for anything to work. This evening smells like cooking. I use it sparingly because it is a rather small bottle. But it does the job
customer_reviews.author: Jody Walker

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Having been using this stuff for a while now and it works well. Cast iron pans are well protected and I don't have to worry about veg oil getting funky on the pans. Does not add any taste to the food.
customer_reviews.author: T. C. F.

customer_reviews.title: I really found this useless
customer_reviews.text: I really found this useless. After several attempts I just went to the local box store and bought some vegetable oil. Worked many times better.
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: good oil, but has a very low smoke point
customer_reviews.text: the oil has an interesting smell - not acrid or anything, but interesting. however, the oil's smoke point is very low, so if you season your pan with this (even lightly) and then go to pre-heat the pan on the stove for a bit the next time you use it (even at a medium heat), it'll start to smoke pretty early on in the heating process. maybe i'm not doing this whole cooking thing right, but i like to get the pan good and hot before i put anything in it, and the smoke that's given off as a result of using this seasoning oil is a bit of a deterrent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love how easy it makes using Cast Iron
customer_reviews.text: I use it every time I finish washing my Cast Iron (w salt and hot water, which also works great!) I put a few drops of this oil in the Cast Iron pan and use a paper towel to spread the oil over the whole pan. I make sure to wipe any extra out. It keeps the pan every well seasoned, not extra steps needed! Love It!
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: If you cook with cast iron, you are going to want this product in your arsenal.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly. Well packaged. Extremely effective and easy to use. Will buy again. A product that protects and ensures the quality and life of your cast iron. Thank you for the discovery. I have cooked with cast iron all my life. Thank you for your great service. An old and seasoned cook.
customer_reviews.author: james burke

customer_reviews.title: cast iron oil
customer_reviews.text: all u need is drop to season any cast iron pot or pan. Will last a long time, does not leave any residue or staining. doesn't interfer with any of your cooking. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: luvher74

customer_reviews.title: Must have !
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product . We use his every time we use our cast iron products. ( after cooking). We have only had our cast iron for a few weeks and have used this each time after clean up. We have begun to notice the non-stick part working much better , and this product helps your cast iron look like it is new! Would reccomened to anyone with cast iron! (Scent is no overbearing, there is a slight sweet , coconut scent)
customer_reviews.author: Vannah

customer_reviews.title: I have no problem rating this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: I have a cast iron griddle that had a tiny bit of light rust spots showing up here & there so I cleaned it up a bit and coated it with the Caron & Doucet cast iron oil and baked it in the oven awhile. ( Not to hot or it will smoke horribly! ) It turned out better than I imagined, I mean it was absolutely beautiful! I'm sold on this stuff and will now be using it on all of my cast iron.
customer_reviews.author: R.W."Mack"

customer_reviews.title: Our cast iron skillets are brand new again
customer_reviews.text: Since purchasing this product we have used our cast iron skillets again! We used to season the old way and they never seemed to keep. Since starting this we find the pans are easier to cook in and clean. We already use coconut oil for a healthier diet, this just adds to our lifestyle without adding any flavor or additional oil residue on the pan or the food. a quick clean, a touch of cast iron oil and the pan is ready for the next meal. Thank you for your fine product!
customer_reviews.author: sue trimble

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I have ever used anything like this for my cast iron skillet. I really like it, easy to use and makes skillet just like non stick. Will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: A blessing for cast iron
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Easiest to use. Thin enough to penetrate into surface. Pleasant but innocuous scent. I use primarily for after cooking maintenance. I haven't tried it yet with this product but I believe it would polymerize well.
customer_reviews.author: NeedaRez

customer_reviews.title: Love this oil
customer_reviews.text: I keep this little bottle right by the stove. Sprinkle a little and rub around cast iron pan after cleaning. Keeps the pan seasoned, and does not affect the taste of food at all. Will continue to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Frey

customer_reviews.title: Its useless, it doesnt work that good
customer_reviews.text: Its useless,it doesnt work that good. Olive oil does better job
customer_reviews.author: Magda T.

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Others
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Application was easier then other solid products. The seal coat it produced made my pan much more "non-stick." It has a lovely fresh scent. All-and-all, very nice product! I would recommend it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: After cleaning my cast iron pans, it takes but just a minute using the cast iron oil, to make my pans look like new again. And after using for a few times, the pans clean-up much quicker and easier. I think this cast iron seasoning oil and cleaner is just great!! So glad I learned about it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn L. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Don't have to smoke the oil
customer_reviews.text: Love this product , no smoking the pan easy and clean smelling
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims
customer_reviews.text: Have used this to re-season an old neglected skillet and bring it back to its former glory as well as to keep my current pans in great working condition. It did fill the house with smoke when re-seasoning the old skillet, but that was expected.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: It does ok. Doesn't do as good as the old lard.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Adams

customer_reviews.title: Look no further, this is the one to buy!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this oil for my pan! It smells great, and keeps my pan in pristine condition. I use my pan several times a week and use this oil every time I clean it and it has lasted me a year or more. I will by no other brand than this!
customer_reviews.author: Sorbelicious

customer_reviews.title: Works great with all my cast iron!
customer_reviews.text: I scrub my cast iron with kosher salt and hot water after each use. After drying I apply a thin coat of this oil on all surfaces and store away for the next use. I also seasoned them all with this product. Great product and recommended.
customer_reviews.author: dclawton

customer_reviews.title: Simple to apply
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to use and it oiled the skillet and I had none of my food sticking with the next use of skillet.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzi

customer_reviews.title: Good minus the smell
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using it for about a week and it seems to work well, the only gripe I have with it is that it smell like a a broken fish oil capsule and pine sap mixed in. Luckily it dissipates and does not effect the taste of the food being cooked.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Good oil for the skillet
customer_reviews.text: Very good oil for my cast iron. I’ll admit, I wasn’t taking care of my cast iron skillet. I’ve neglected it and then had to take the time to bring it back. Well I got tired of playing that game and decided to start taking. Care of it more. I ordered the Caron & Doucet oil and have been pleased with it so far. A little goes a very long way. The only thing that stopped me from giving it a 5 Star is that their is that weird coconut oil smell.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua mayer

customer_reviews.title: Cast Iron Oil
customer_reviews.text: I now have 2 cast iron skillets so I wanted a special oil made for it. I didn't want to use anything else but this to keep it in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthann Liljenberg

customer_reviews.title: Love It...
customer_reviews.text: I use this regularly on all my cast iron. It is the best product that I have ever seen to take care of cast iron. Clean the pan, apply the oil and it soaks in and helps keep food from sticking and maintains a nice environment for the iron...You don't have to season your pan, constantly.
customer_reviews.author: zonie

customer_reviews.title: works!
customer_reviews.text: I have mild OCD, if there is such a thing... and this helps... Great product...
customer_reviews.author: Franklin F.

customer_reviews.title: The pan cleans up easy, and I always apply another coat of Caron ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this oil for the last few weeks. I cook steaks sous vide and use my cast iron grill-skillet for the final searing. I have been able crank up the burner to full heat for five minutes, sear my steak on the smoking, branding-iron hot skillet, and use no cooking oil whatsoever. The pan cleans up easy, and I always apply another coat of Caron & Doucet. It just keeps getting better. Also, I have exploited the rancid-proof property of Caron & Doucet and used it as a lubricant for my citrus press. Obviously, I am living on the edge!
customer_reviews.author: Practice_Mindfulness

customer_reviews.title: cast iorn oil
customer_reviews.text: this has worked for me very well. Smells great' I use it after each use of my pan to keep it oiled
customer_reviews.author: melissa pelham

customer_reviews.title: Have bought again
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for reseasoning cast iron and carbon steel pans. Tried others, but this works great and the pleasant smell is an asset.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B

customer_reviews.title: this works great ! on your gas grill cast iron grating
customer_reviews.text: I use this oil to coat my cast iron gas grill, 1. put the oil into a spray bottle 2. spray the cast iron grate completely 3. heat and up the grill to high let it cook/burn off for 25 min. to 1/2 hour. this has stopped my cast iron grating from rusting and allows me to cook steaks and chicken with less clean up . I bought 3 bottles to keep around just to re-season every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: S. O.

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use!
customer_reviews.text: I have a cast iron skillet that needed some work and this seem to do the job really well.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Okay for upkeep but do not heat.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for seasoning. However, I do not think that is what they had in mind for this. It smoked at 350 degrees and caused a huge issue in the house. I would say for "conditioning" it would be all right. A bit after rinsing or whatever would work. As a seasoning agent, I will stick with flaxseed oil. Less smoke and better finish.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Works great on iron skillets
customer_reviews.text: If you have iron skillets, this is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Lavenia

customer_reviews.title: the product works
customer_reviews.text: It's lovely to read and ad and it is the Truth ! So many times I have been disappointed but not with this product thank you Marilee Wales
customer_reviews.author: Anne M. Wales

customer_reviews.title: Cast iron maintenance
customer_reviews.text: It’s great use for cast iron pans. It keeps the pan looking seasoned. I used a metal scrubber but wasn’t satisfied because the pan looks dry,
customer_reviews.author: sylvia santos

customer_reviews.title: A little bit goes a long ways
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use, a little bit goes along ways..its a good size bottle that will last awhile, so well worth the money, which was a good price.. I will definitely order the cast Iron Oil again.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Triplett

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  As far as I can tell.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure this is working to keep my cast iron looking good. At the very least, it smells good.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Moren

customer_reviews.title: Great product for your cast iron!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product and a little goes a long way. I use it after every use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it works beautifully. It's a nice
customer_reviews.text: Used in conjunction with the soap, it works beautifully. It's a nice, light oil that doesn't get in the way of cooking. It gets used after every wash.
customer_reviews.author: Sami

customer_reviews.title: must have for your cast iron stuff
customer_reviews.text: much better than vegetable oil for my cast iron cookware ... easy to apply/treat ... works great
customer_reviews.author: Jim the Walker

customer_reviews.title: didn't really like this. It burns easily
customer_reviews.text: Eh, despite the positive reviews, didn't really like this. It burns easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Yi

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great for a really non stick surface! Does not get gooey like some other oils.
customer_reviews.author: Disneygirl53

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant smell no sticky residue
customer_reviews.text: Liked how this cast iron seasoning oil does not leave any sticky spots. Pleasant smell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. It keeps my ironware in perfect shape
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. It keeps my ironware in perfect shape. Easy to use, does not impart "extra" flavor to food, and I would recommend over the flaxseed-based alternatives. Staying with the best!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I'd like to see how it holds up over time
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to see how it holds up over time, but so far it seems to be doing a great job, and does not leave a sticky residue like some seasoning oils
customer_reviews.author: S. Seng

customer_reviews.title: I also bought a cast iron brush and with the two it was an easy clean.
customer_reviews.text: I cleaned very old cast iron from my mother and grandmother

customer_reviews.title: Easy, lasts, smells really nice
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. It's easy to use and lasts multiple cooking cycles. The true surprise is the herb like fragrance that comes from applying it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Sikes

customer_reviews.title: Best product for cast iron products
customer_reviews.text: Best product ever! I got it with the whole set, all natural and works. I even bought it as a gift for my aunt.

customer_reviews.title: great to maintain seasoned cast ironpans
customer_reviews.text: Although it is a bit pricey it is a great product and in the end worth every penny. Keeps pans in good shape and has a pleasant scent
customer_reviews.author: Gmando61

customer_reviews.title: great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Good product, seasoned my blackstone with it. Did a perfect season!!

customer_reviews.title: Smell good like lemon pledge
customer_reviews.text: I like the smell better than grease or cooking oil. Keeps my pots from rusting helps build a good seasoning.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Cambre

customer_reviews.title: Best Cast Iron Product
customer_reviews.text: I love the finish on my antique cast iron skillets - smooth surface and non-stick.

customer_reviews.title: good stuff. i am using on botha brand new ...
customer_reviews.text: good stuff. i am using on botha brand new pan as well as one that is about 70 years old!
customer_reviews.author: STEPHANIE NEWSOM

customer_reviews.title: I much prefer using olive oil or any other type ...
customer_reviews.text: I much prefer using olive oil or any other type of oil to season my pans over this product. Did not do anything to help the seasoning and I don't think it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Monica C

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Seasons the pans awesome, after cleaning. We use a brush and cast iron soap from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: GBen

customer_reviews.title: so far pleased with product
customer_reviews.text: Back to using iron skillet, so far pleased with product. Have never really used the right "stuff" and ended up with a rusty iron skillet that didn't look too appealing to cook in, not sure how my Mom did it all when I was young without non-stick pans.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Brown

customer_reviews.title: C & D Seasoning Oil
customer_reviews.text: We received the oil very quickly from the vendor. We washed our cast iron skillet thoroughly and applied the Caron & Doucet seasoning oil. The difference is very noticeable with the C & D oil. Less food is sticking and clean up is easy. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Henning

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely buy it again and recommend it to others
customer_reviews.text: This product works well on cast iron cookware and only takes a small amount to do the job. I would definitely buy it again and recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: cillah

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Does not seem to build up for ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Does not seem to build up for the complete seasoned iron pan...but does quickly and safely prevent my cast iron from rusting.
customer_reviews.author: Dancer60

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Using this on my four burner propane griddle to season and clean, works flawlessly!

customer_reviews.title: Must have for your cast iron pans
customer_reviews.text: Works great to keep my pans looking and performing well.
customer_reviews.author: Christine M Schoen

customer_reviews.title: The oil is all natural nut oils. After use ...
customer_reviews.text: The oil is all natural nut oils. After use, the cast iron cookware returned to new black. The only drawback is the smoke it produces while curing in the oven. Over all, it is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Denese

customer_reviews.title: Great product@
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to cooking with cast iron. This is great to coat the pan after use.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Essential for my cast iron!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use; pleasant smell that lasts about as long as it takes to rub the oil in; keeps my cast iron pan interiors shiny and ready for their next use. Looking this up to order my next bottle; don’t want to run out!
customer_reviews.author: RRN in Iowa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have used more of a gel before but this stuff is awesome. Spreads easier and requires very little to treat the pan.

customer_reviews.title: I love the oil and use it every time I use ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the oil and use it every time I use my cast iron pans. Works better than olive or corn oil.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff and works well. However if you're trying to save some loot just use coconut oil. This however lasts longer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used it once and brought the shine back to original when first purchase the my grill

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff - Try it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this oil. Still waiting for a spray bottle. (Guess I'll get my own and pour the oil in.) Just seems like I'd be able to control the amount used - not too little, too much, just right amount.

customer_reviews.title: Stinks
customer_reviews.text: This oil smells like deet. It may be good for long term storage but I'll stick with cooking oil for my everyday pans.

product_meta.title: Caron & Doucet - Cast Iron Seasoning & Cleaning Oil | 100% Plant-Based & will NOT to go Rancid! | Best for Seasoning, Restoring, Curing and Care after Cleaning | For Skillets, Pans & Cast Iron.
product_meta.description: Size:8 oz100% Plant-Based Cast Iron Seasoning & Cleaning Oil. Formulated to build & maintain the best natural non-stick seasoning for your cast iron skillets, pans, woks or grills. Made with a solvent-less refined coconut oil base that unlike our competitors is safe & guaranteed to never go rancid. Designed to season & condition cast iron while protecting cookware from moisture that leads to damage & rust. Makes cleaning cast iron easier by creating a seasoning that is non-stick & prevents food from drying on. | - IDEAL FOR - | Cast Iron Skillets, Cast Iron Pots & Frying Pans, Cast Iron Grills & Griddles, Cast Iron Woks, Cast Iron Dutch Ovens, Cast Iron Cookware. | - DIRECTIONS - | For cast iron that has rust damage, use Caron & Doucet Cast Iron Salt Scrub first to remove any damage spots. Wash & clean your cast iron cookware with Caron & Doucet Cast Iron Soap to remove any left-over food residues. Dry the cast iron completely before applying oil. Pour two tablespoons of Caron & Doucet Cast Iron Oil onto the cookware & use a microfiber cloth to work the oil into the cast iron. Let sit, and dry for 30 minutes. | - INGREDIENTS - | Refined Coconut Oil, Proprietary Blend of Pure Essential Oils.
feature_bullets: PREMIUM CAST IRON CONDITIONING & SEASONING OIL | Made with the highest quality, solvent-less, refined coconut oil base that is safe for cast iron surfaces. The result is a premium product that unlike our competitors is guaranteed not to go rancid.

SEASONS CAST IRON | Designed to season & condition cast iron while protecting cookware from moisture that leads to damage & rust. Makes cleaning cast iron easier by creating a seasoning that is non-stick & prevents food from drying on.

CLEANS & ELIMINATES ODORS | Enhanced with a proprietary blend of pure essential oils that help to naturally eliminate food odours. Will leave your cast iron skillet or cookware looking & smelling clean, yet neutral. Very light scent that will not transfer onto food.

DOES NOT GO RANCID | Unlike canola oil, hemp, flax seed or other types of common cooking oils, this cast iron oil will never go rancid. It is made with a solvent-less, refined coconut oil base that has had it’s long-chain fatty acids removed.

BACKED BY THE CARON FAMILY GUARANTEE | Our family takes great pride in the products we create & are confident you & your family will enjoy them as much as we do. If for any reason you are not 100% satisfied, we'll refund your money!
